events.message: The insured contacted the company to report a car accident that occurred on April 30. They provided initial details about the vehicle collision and the extent of damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident cluster due to the involvement of a vehicle collision and accident damage.
An agent was assigned promptly to handle the insured's claim, ensuring a single point of contact for reporting and further assistance.
The insured received official acknowledgment of the claim submission, confirming that processing has started and documents will be requested shortly.
The agent requested supporting documents including the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates.
The insured submitted all requested documents promptly, including the official police report and detailed images of the collision damage.
A formal investigation started to assess liability and verify the extent of damages claimed in the accident.
The investigation concluded confirming that the insured was not at fault and damage assessments were consistent with submitted documentation.
Based on the investigation results, a settlement amount for the vehicle repair costs was proposed to the insured.
The insured provided positive feedback on the efficiency and fairness of the settlement proposal process.
Approval was granted for the settlement amount, authorizing payment to proceed for vehicle repairs.
The payment was issued to the insuredâ€™s repair shop to cover the full cost of approved vehicle repairs.
Following successful payment, the claim was formally closed with no outstanding actions pending.
